title: 820-00239 No PM_EN_P3V3_G3H
message: This board has one issue in that it can't get PM_EN_P3V3_G3H because the pad is blown off on the enable line leading to U6903 to make PP3V3_G3H. See picture. Does anyone have any novel way of dealing with this type of thing? I need to get 3.3V to pin 10 but there's nothing I can tap in to. All I have is the 5V (then 20V) USB power line. I was thinking about trying to throw a couple resistors on there for a voltage divider but the problem is the line goes from 5V up to 20V so the voltage would be way to high on the enable once it bumps to 20V.

title: 820-00239 No PM_EN_P3V3_G3H
message:
PM_EN_P3V3_G3H comes out from U7000 and has 4-5V level.
Try to get it from R7075...

title: 820-00239 No PM_EN_P3V3_G3H
message: That's perfect, thanks. Didn't see that voltage line there. Turns on fine now. Thanks.
